alert.note: Alert for Crawford; Franklin; Sebastian (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued November 04 at 10:04PM CDT until November 04 at 11:45PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1145 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR CENTRAL CRAWFORD, FRANKLIN AND SEBASTIAN COUNTIES... At 1004 PM CDT, Although the heavy rainfall has ended, flooding of low lying areas could continue in a few locations. HAZARD...Flooding from previous heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that could experience flooding include... Ozark... Charleston... Greenwood... Alma... Barling... Lavaca... Mulberry... Dyer... Hackett... Altus... Hartford... Huntington... Branch... Midland... Denning... Wiederkehr Village... Bloomer... Fort Chaffee... FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
